title: Features that a mobile event application must have (Kathy Griffin)
text: By Kathy Griffin Oct 15, 2015 Over the recent years technology has advanced to a great extent. Keeping with that, 80% of event attendees use smartphones and other mobile devices. On an average, they spend more than sixty hours in a week, consuming content on their mobile devices. If you are associated with the event management industry, and haven't developed an event app yet, it might be the right time to jump on the mobile event application bandwagon. Since your attendees prefer to access the Internet from their mobile devices, it would be wise to provide them with the event related information at their fingertips. Event planners around the world are utilizing mobile apps to a great extent. It not only improves attendee engagement and experience, but also helps keep attendees updated on important information.Features to include in an event applicationWhile it's true that event applications provide a platform for communication, and help event planners turn the events into success, it is important to understand what attendees look for in a mobile event app. Since the ultimate motto is to improve user experience, the event planners should focus on what features to include in an app.* It should be device agnostic - While investing in a mobile event application, you would surely like all your attendees to access the app. It's quite obvious that the attendees would use smartphones, computers and tablets with different platforms like Google Android, Apple iOS, Windows or BlackBerry. It is advisable to not to waste your money and time on developing native apps that are device specific. Attendees too have to go through cumbersome app store processes in order to use these apps. Instead, you should create apps based on HTML5 standard so that attendees can access those from any device.* The app should be easy to use - One of the most important features of a mobile event app is intuitive and simple user interface. Ensure easy navigation so that your attendees don't face any problem while using the application. Don't include too many features as this will create confusion among the attendees. If they find the event management app to be complicated to use, they might lose interest in it and refrain from using it. Hence, keep the application as simple as possible.* Instant access should be ensured - The most user friendly apps take hardly any time to get downloaded. It would be best if you can direct attendees to an event URL through their Internet browser. Next, the app will automatically get downloaded within few seconds. If you want to make the process more convenient, consider giving easy instructions following which attendees can save the event app on the home screen of their devices. * Attendees should be able to use the app offline - A not-so-sound Internet connection may ruin the app experience of attendees. Hence, the app should be designed in a way, such that attendees can access it anytime, even without Internet connection.These are some of the features that increase the acceptability of a mobile event application. About the Author Kathy Griffin is a popular author with more than ten years of experience. She has vast knowledge of mobile event application. Rating:
